title: Google\Cloud\BigQuery\QueryResults
name: QueryResults
description:
QueryResults represent the result of a BigQuery SQL query. Read more at the Query Response API Documentation.

This class should be not instantiated directly, but as a result of calling Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::runQuery() or Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Job::queryResults().

params.name: reloadOptions
params.description: The options to use when reloading query data.

methods.name: rows
methods.description:
Retrieves the rows associated with the query and merges them together with the table's schema. It is recommended to check the completeness of the query before attempting to access rows.

Refer to the table below for a guide on how BigQuery types are mapped as they come back from the API.

PHP Type BigQuery Data Type
\DateTimeInterface DATETIME
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Bytes BYTES
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Date DATE
Google\Cloud\Core\Int64 INTEGER
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Time TIME
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Timestamp TIMESTAMP
Associative Array RECORD
Non-Associative Array RECORD (Repeated)
float FLOAT
int INTEGER
string STRING
bool BOOLEAN

exceptions.description: Thrown if the query has not yet completed.

methods.name: isComplete
methods.description: Checks the query's completeness. Useful in combination with Google\Cloud\BigQuery\QueryResults::reload() to poll for query status.

methods.name: reload
methods.description:
Triggers a network request to reload the query's details.

Useful when needing to poll an incomplete query for status. Configuration options will be inherited from Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Job::queryResults() or Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::runQuery(), but they can be overridden if needed.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to read per page.

params.name: options.timeoutMs
params.description: How long to wait for the query to complete, in milliseconds. Defaults to 10000 milliseconds (10 seconds).

methods.name: identity
methods.description:
Retrieves the query result's identity.

An identity provides a description of a nested resource.
